lines.text: You've got a BMW. Act like it!
Let's just be quiet and let him do his little thing and we'll be on our way.
Oh, I will let you be on your way, and when you go...
[bellows]
THE CAT'S EYES'LL SPIN! NOW, LISTEN!
Ok, we'll listen!

[calm again]
Hey, hey, ha! Ho ha! Heh heh heh heh! Hoola, Hoola, Hoola! The Boola Boola Boola! Look who's got the front seats to the Mexican hat dance now! Just like a bunch of spiders in a birthday cake!
They're Brazillionaires, they have breakfast at 2pm in the afternoon.

[Chris is chained and Eldona is trying on outfits before him]
Eldona, you know he's not supposed to see you this special day?
Special day? What is it - Halloween?

[the three are playing cards]
If I win, I get... another bowl of cereal!
If I win, I get... Diane!

[cutesy]
No, Lil' Debbull
Hi! I'm Bobo, that's Lil' Debbull!
Hi, we're not allowed inside the house!

[asking about Chris' job]
Banker?
No, not banker. Financial publisher. "Thorne Weekly"?
Ok, banker.
Thanks for the espresso maker... and the bag of shit.
How long have you been divorced?
Four years.
Do you still love her.
Nah, been over her for... weeks.
Y'know, you are worse than a week of yellow shitstorms.

[passing "No Cussing" sign]
Oh, and no cussing.
Oh, shit.
Welcome to Supper! How 'bout a nice Hawaiian Punch?
Thank you, Judge. You know, there's nothing better at the end of a long day on the road than a nice warm glass of Hawaiian Punch.
You people are sick, wicked, funky, misanthropic, co-dependent animals! And I won't have my sister, who was once the Queen of the Mardi Gras, sitting at a table with a pickle-shooting train!
Alvin, I was just thinking you've got enough vintage steel around here to make a few thousand Toyotas. Ever think of selling the whole place to the Japanese?
There you go. Does the Pope wear a hat? Was Sergeant York's mother an angel? And will a banker grope for money?
I'm not a banker, I'm a financial publisher.

Well, all I know is in '17 after they shipped me off to fight, some New York financier rolled in here one day and hog-glowsered and tub-wankled my grandfather into mining out the whole town in exchange for shares in something called the United Coke Company. Do you know what those stock certificates are worth today?
[shouts]

JUST ABOUT THE FINEST OUTHOUSE WALLPAPER YOU'VE EVER SEEN! We were forced to become what you drove through today; a burnt out coal field and the biggest icebox graveyard this side of the Ohio foundry belt! And that's why I *never* let a banker go!
So your grandpa made a lousy deal, is that our problem?
Judge, that's a very tragic, tragic story.
I believe it is.
You should do a book.
If it was an ambulance you got a chance, if it's in a hearse, it's gotta be worse!
You really put the pin in the party hog now, girl!
Get yer Eye-talian loafers outta my bedpan!
Evening, Mr. Thorne.

[getting out of the car]
110 blocks in less than 15 minutes, not bad for a one-eyed Russian immigrant.
Where are we going?
We're going to Atlantic City, Fausto. Get in the trunk.
I should have known. A Brazillionaire never forgets.
Go suck a bug.
You may kiss the bride.
Oh, not in front of all these people, your honor.

[yelling]
NOW!
No choice now but house policy.
Fine, house policy! *What's* house policy?
Well, whatever man she touches is the one she keeps!
Aw, no!
[Eldona carries him off happily]
Oh, come on, all I did run a goddamn stoplight! I just want to get to Atlantic City!

[referring to Miss Purdah]
Man, she is one ugly, cross-burnin', redneck, peckerwood, police bitch, man.

You might be interested to know that you are *not* under the jurisdiction of just any old fishing license dispenser and stamp pad jockey! We've always been set to deal with the offenders *once* and for all at their first appearance! Quick as sump grease through a ten-year old goose!
[whistles]
Congratulations, I'm glad to know thing are running smoothly for you.
[lights a cigar]

[bellows]
PUT OUT THAT DOG ROCKET!
[passing two dirty bikers]
Evil Knievel and Mr. Clean.
I didn't forget the butter. It was Antonio, Antonio, the butler, forgot the butter.
[passing by three half-buried dolphin statues]
So that's where they buried Flipper.
Flipper is dead?
[passing a group of hillbillies]
Morning. Sell pork bellies, buy gold.
[Eldona is about to throw Diane into an oil well after being chased by Bobo and L'il Debbull]
Eldona's got her, that's good.
That's not good!
No, that's not good!
What are you saying, it's death or Eldona?
You're the one who's fat!
Not as fat as you!
I'm of the school that believes that the last thirty seconds of a person's life ought to have a little zip in them!

[after insulting the Reeve and falling in a chamber of squeaky toys, she punches him]
How could you be so insensitive?
What do you mean? What are you talking about?
Fausto, you better do something about this!
Niña, you're pulling on my coat, now cool it!
I had us out of here! Then you had to go and open your big mouth!
[pulls toy out of her shirt]
*You* had us out of here? We would've been here another two hours listening to the history of the Valkenburger farm or wherever the hell we are!
I knew that I couldn't depend on you!
Listen, I don't need this! I was just trying to get us to Atlantic City... for YOU!

[sarcastic]
Oh, is that right?
Yeah!
You're no longer our financial advisor! You're fired!

[to Fausto]
SHUT UP!

[after being stopped by Dennis, a police officer]
Folks, meet Andy Griffith!
It smells like São Paulo!

[the drug dealers are stopped for speeding]
I'm afraid you'll have to blow.
Blow *you* to get out of a ticket? Come on!
[chuckles]
That's not funny, I meant you'll have to use a Breathalyzer.
I'll blow 'im!
Maybe later. Next century. Let's go.

[laughing as they see Judge Valkenheiser]
Oh my God! Would you look at his face? Is that nose rubber?
Hey, I don't want you, I want Judge Wapner.
I have to plead to the Fifth Dimension.
Ày, Fausto, you are going to make me swim through toxics! Ày, Fausto, Fausto, I cannot believe it!
Baby, we've got to swim to the freeway!

[at the dinner table, a meat grinder makes a whining noise like a dog]
How do you like your dog?
They're serving dog?
Oh, no, no, no ,*hot* dogs, *hot* dogs. Dutch country, prized Hereford winners.

[relieved]
Oh! Hot dogs!

[abou tthe criminals]
Would you watch things around here for a minute? I'm gonna go for a smoke.
Go for a smoke? But, Dennis, they've got guns, drugs! One of 'em tried to kill ya! I'm stayin' to watch!

[to Chris]
I didn't mean what I said when I told you to save yourself. Get your ass back down here and SAVE ME!

[about Chris and company]
I recommend fine, bond, and release.
Ah, tut tut tut tut! What else you wanna do for them, bake 'em a pie?

[about the judge]
Does he treat all traffic violators this graciously?
Only ones he takes a special interest in, like bankers.
Wait, I'm entitled to one phone call.
Surely, and you're more than welcome to make one, *if* we had a phone.
Where's that no-good, dog food eatin' grandson of mine... DENNIS!

[Chris tries to hit him in the thigh]
I left that leg in France... and now, I'M GONNA STICK YOU! I'm gonna dig so many new holes in you, you're gonna look like a salt shaker!
[first lines]

[as they leave a car and go into a building to a party]
20 minutes, hello, good-bye.
Ok.
Fun is actually knowing who half your guests are.

[in the elevator]
Chris, come, I save it for you.
That's what she says to all the guys.
Chris, put this tape on, Las Chankas.
[asking Chris if he takes Eldona to be his wife]

[stuttering]
I di...
Pardon?

[stuttering]
bu...
What?

[stuttering]
I can'...
Speak up!

[sweating]
I do. I do.
Come on, death for running a stop sign?
*And* for being a banker! That's the double death.
